clinical_study.brief_title: Utilization of the Mirror During Pelvic Exams
clinical_study.official_title: Utilization of the Mirror During Pelvic Exams: Does it Reduce Patient Vulnerability and Discomfort?

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective cohort study to determine if using a birthing mirror during the patient's pelvic examination decreases patients's degree of vulnerability and discomfort.

detailed_description.textblock:
In Obstetrics and Gynecology and its gynecologic subspecialties, the pelvic examination is routine practice for screening and diagnostic purposes. Nevertheless, due to their intimate nature, pelvic examinations may result in loss of control, embarrassment, discomfort and anxiety.
The mirror pelvic exam has been a proposed technique to decrease patient anxiety and improve comfort during an already uncomfortable examination. However, little research has focused on this modality to date.
The purpose of this study is to investigate whether the mirror pelvic exam decreases the level of vulnerability and discomfort experienced during the pelvic examination.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analog Scale (VAS) on level of vulnerability
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before the pelvic exam and within 30 minutes after the pelvic exam
primary_outcome.description: VAS on vulnerability level will be measured before and after the pelvic exam, and the change will be calculated per subject. The VAS is a validated 100 millimeter scale with 'no vulnerability' represented as 0 mm and 'very vulnerable' equating to 100 mm.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analog Scale (VAS) on level of pain/discomfort
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before the pelvic exam and within 30 minutes after the pelvic exam
primary_outcome.description: VAS on discomfort level will be measured before and after the pelvic exam, and the change will be calculated per subject. The VAS is a validated 100 millimeter scale with 'no pain' represented as 0 mm and 'most pain' equating to 100 mm.

arm_group.description: This group of patients agree to have the mirror pelvic exam, and they will undergo routine pelvic examination by a physician with the usage of a mirror in the room.
This group of patients decline a mirror, and they will undergo the standard pelvic examination.

intervention.description: using a mirror during the pelvic examination

study_pop.textblock: All women 18 years of age to 80, who undergo pelvic exam by a physician at Cincinnati Urogynecology Associates, TriHealth will be approached for recruitment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- New patients undergoing a pelvic exam performed by a physician at Cincinnati Urogynecology Associates, TriHealth
Exclusion Criteria:
- Existing patients
- Unwillingness to participate in the study
- Physical or mental impairment that would affect the subject's ability to visualize the mirror during examination or to complete questionnaires
- Inability to understand English
